intro: Meoschium australe, commonly known as the southern meoschium, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered white or pink flowers. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Meoschium australe is often found in heathlands and open woodlands, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
